channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2024030927
item.description:
Report X-2024030927

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being transported by cart from trailer to van line. During transport, the cart turned and the box fell from the cart, landing upside down. Upon seeing leakage, package was reoriented right side up, then transferred into a postage container. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 bottles leaked via the caps, appearing visually less full than the others. The caps on the leaking bottles feel rough to twist and are slightly misaligned to the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Majority of the leakage was absorbed by the external box itself, ruining it in the process. Bottles were removed from box and placed inside a postage bin along with the failed box. Neutralizing agent powder was spread on the spill site.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE X-RAY AT THE UPS FACILITY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM, ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM THE USA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN FOUR FLAMMABLE AEROSOL PRODUCTS AND ONE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE PERFUME. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. INVOICE AND THERMAL LABEL DESCRIBE CONTENTS AS A SUITCASE WITH CLOTHING.

item.description:

  • Description: 1. X-2024030942 SequenceEvent: QA was called to head towards load side 3 and upon arrival QA was notified that the package was leaking. Once QA was notified of damaged hazmat they then quarantined the area ran to get the apropriate gear and items to bag the package. Once they bagged all the packages they then nutralized the spilled content and cleaned the area. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom was wet and when we opened the package we inspected all bottles inside and noticed that there was a crack at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quarantined the area and placed spill mats and then spreaded out nutrilizing agent. 2. X-2024030943 SequenceEvent: QA was called to head towards load side 3 and upon arrival QA was notified that the package was leaking. Once QA was notified of damaged hazmat they then quarantined the area ran to get the apropriate gear and items to bag the package. Once they bagged all the packages they then nutralized the spilled content and cleaned the area. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom was wet and when we opened the package we inspected all bottles inside and noticed that there was a crack at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quarantined the area and placed spill mats and then spreaded out nutrilizing agent.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: EAST MIDLANDS UK
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE X-RAY AT THE UPS FACILITY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM, ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM UNITED ARAB EMIRATES TO THE UNITED KINGDOM WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN A DANGEROUS GOOD PRODUCT. THERE IS ONE CAN OF TURBO DOKHA AIR PIPE CLEANER X 150 ML, CONTENTS COMPRESSED GAS LIQUID 99.9% TETRAFLUOROETHANE, CAS NO 811-97-2. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER SHIPPING POLY BAG MAILER. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT PRIOR TO THE DISCOVERY OF THE UNDECLARED CONTENTS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM UNITED ARAB EMIRATES USING UPS ACCOUNT 84YY56, SMSA EXPRESS TRANSPORTATION LLC, P.O. BOX 36670, DUBAI, UNITED ARAB EMIRATES.

item.title: Report E-2024030433
item.description:
Report E-2024030433

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 14, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN3098 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized duct tape to patch the damaged drums to prevent additional release. TLE crews collected and containerized the damaged drums into two (2) 95-gallon overpack drums for disposal purposes. Soda ash was deployed worked in with hand tools. A granular absorbent and a degreasing agent were deployed and worked in with hand tools. All undamaged cargo was wiped with absorbent pads to remove any residual product and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. All impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal purposes. Soda ash was deployed to neutralize the impacted outside the concrete ground and worked in with hand tools. All impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 35-gallon drum for disposal purposes.

  • Description: On March 19, 2024, one (1) 300-gallon tote of UN2810 was crushed by falling freight and released approximately seventy-five (75) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel completed a tote transfer into one (1) new tote that was staged onsite. The crew deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN2810-impacted materials were containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite.

IN THE DMP, OPENED THE BOX TO BEGIN WORKING ON THE LEAKING TO DISCOVER THE PRODUCT WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL ON IT. IMMEDIATELY STOPPED, AND NOTIFIED RMP, WHO IN TURN NOTIFIED THE CHSP. AFTER CALLING THE UNDECLARED HOTLINE, GOT PERMISSION TO PROCESS THE CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THE OUTSIDE CARTON HAD NO HAZMAT INDICATIONS ON IT. THE INTERIOR OF THE CARTON THE HAZMAT WAS IN A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG WITH ANOTHER ITEM, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S. THERE WAS ONLY THREE AIR BAGS OF PACKING MATERIAL IN THE BOX AS WELL.

  • Description: On March 14, 2024, one (1) 20-gallon drum containing hydrogen peroxide was damaged by a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews placed the damaged 20-gallon drum into a 55-gallon drum and set aside for terminal disposal. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizer to the hydrogen peroxide-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN3085 Kolene No. 5 release from a 500-pound supersack. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 pounds of product released to a 2 x 2 area of the wooden trailer floor and a 15 x 2 area of the concrete dock floor. The supersack was ripped due to improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged sack into a 55-gallon poly drum for shipment on. All released product was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged sack and pads were placed into a third 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

All impacted materials were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket for disposal purposes. The damaged one-gallon jug was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 5-gallon bucket for disposal purposes. The buckets were properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by RLC to be disposed of through their bulk waste stream.

  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN THE TRAILER ON BAY 51. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE AND USING THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER PLASTIC CONTAINERS WAS CRACKED AND LOOSE BY 1/6 OF A TURN, RESULTING IN TWO OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO PACKING MATERIAL.

  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED 9MM 147GR RN LOW RECOIL (900 FPS) 500 ROUNDS. THESE INNER BOXES CONTAINED LOOSE AMMUNITION WITH SOME POKING THROUGH ONE SIDE OF THE INNER BOXES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE AMMUNITION WAS BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM ATL TO SDF PRIOR TO THE DISCOVERY.

  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT IRREG SHIPMENT WAS DISCOVERED DRIPPING LIQUID AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY THE UNLOAD SUPERVISOR IN SECTION-B DOOR 13 ON THE CATWALK. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE AREA HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND CONTACTED THE DMP. A DESINGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 2 MINUTES WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED AND A SMALL 6" RADIUS PUDDLE CLEANED UP, THEN ALL AFFECTED MATERIALS WERE TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED A MINISCULE PIN-HEAD SIZE PUNCTURE HOLE AT THE CORNER OF THE BASE OF A 5-GAL POLY, CLOSED HEAD PAIL.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (!) 275-gallon tote of UN3266 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. FCE personnel transferred the product from damaged tote into a new one to be shipped off to its destination.

  • Description: AT 20:00 WHILE PERFORMING A HAZMAT AUDIT ON A PACKAGE CAR UPS HAZMAT AUDITOR PULLED AN UN MARKED BOX AND OPENED THE PACKING SLIP LOCATED ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOX. SHE THEN LOOKED UP THE SDS FOR THE PRODUCT LISTED ON THE PACKING SLIP AND NOTICED IT SAID THE ITEM WAS REGULATED FOR TRANSPORTATION. SHE THEN CALLED THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER WHO INSTRUCTED HER TO OPEN THE BOX TO CONFIRM THE CONTENTS. THE CONTENTS WERE CONFIRMED AND THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER SAID THE BOX WAS A SUSPECTED UNDECLARED HAZMAT AND TO GIVE IT TO A DESIGNATED RESPONDER.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1760 was missing a lid and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product and swept them up with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the one (1) impacted 5-gallon jug, and one (1) 5-gallon bucket that contained the impacted cardboard and any neutralized product were generated as waste, labeled appropriately, and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.description:
Report E-2024030455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LAB experienced a UN1789 Blue Whale Muriatic Acid pH Reducer release from a box containing (2) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 4 x 8 area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Two damaged 1-gallon poly jugs were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. Twelve impacted but not damaged jugs were placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Sodium bicarb was then deployed and utilized to neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted neutralized absorbents and cardboard were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On 3/19/2024, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 2300567 at the station location in Colorado Springs, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing 3 1-quart plastic bottles labeled "Silver Nitrate". The shipment is discovered damaged from spillage from one of the bottles. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, as it does not have to required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and is being held pending an FAA investigation.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report E-2024030393
item.description:
Report E-2024030393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1903 was damaged by falling freight and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1903-impacted trailer and concrete. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 35-gallon drums and the patched tote was placed on a spill pallet. All waste was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal. The crew returned the next day to perform a tote transfer. TLE personnel transferred the product from the damaged 330-gallon tote into a new 375-gallon tote to be shipped off to its destination. The generated waste from the transfer was collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. All waste and the damaged tote was staged in the R+L heat room for transport and disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer 828118 that was sent from 774-HOUS-A at 0653. At approximately 0730 package was unloaded from a tugger cart and placed on portable belt at front of belt 1. Belt 1 manager noticed that the item appeared to have some of its contents spill out from its base and called QA to the belt to inspect the package. Upon inspection it was found that the inner item had a damaged base that allowed its contents to spill out. Item was placed in a yellow salvage drum and secured at QA1 to be processed post sort. DescribePack: inner item (plastic pale) cracked at the seam of its base, approximately 7 inches around. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the item was confirmed to be damaged it was removed from the belt and placed in a salvage drum then secured at QA1 to minimize the potential for items or personnel being harmed by its contents.

item.title: Report E-2024030373
item.description:
Report E-2024030373

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: LANTAU
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT 14:05 LOCAL TIME IN HONG KONG, AIR PACKAGE 1Z8Y202X0464721146 HAD PASSED X-RAY SCAN WHEN A LOADER OBSERVED THE PACKAGE SMOLDERING ON THE BELT. THIS OCCURRED PRIOR TO LOADING INTO AN AIR CONTAINER. A RESPONDER SEGREGATED AND INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND A THERMAL EVENT OCCURRING WITH THIRTEEN OF THE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. AT 14:17 LOCAL TIME AIR PACKAGE 1Z8Y202X0466413289 WHICH WAS TRAVELING UNDER THE SAME MULTI-PIECE SHIPMENT WAS FOUND SMOLDERING AFTER HAVING ALREADY BEEN LOADED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER. PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED TO FIND EIGHT LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CHARRED INSIDE THE PACKAGE. LITHIUM ION BATTERIES IN BOTH PACKAGES INVOLVED IN THE THERMAL EVENT WERE ISOLATED. INSPECTION OF THE BATTERIES DO NOT INDICATE THE WATT HOURS. THE THERMAL EVENTS THAT OCCURRED INSIDE BOTH PACKAGES WERE ISOLATED TO THE LITHIUM ION BATTERIES ALONE. THERE IS NO EVIDENCE OF CHARRING ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOXES. THE PACKAGES WERE PART OF A 77 MULTI-PIECE SHIPMENT SCHEDULED TO TRAVEL FROM HONG KONG TO THE USA. THE PACKAGES HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT. THE SHIPMENT WAS PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH IATA PI 965 SECTION IA WITH A SHIPPERS DECLARATION, CAO LABELS, CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY LABELS, MARKINGS AND OUTER UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING. PER 49CFR 171.15, THE INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER UNDER REPORT 1393931.

The MNNR refused interchange on the railcar and notified the Union Pacific Railroad of the discovery. The Union Pacific hired Rybak Environmental Inc. to look at the car and clean up the side of the car. Upon inspection by Rybak, it was discovered that the car was missing a manhole gasket.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The commodity being shipped are Duracell dry cell batteries. While the shipment is classified as "nonhazard", the shipment began to emit dangerous evolution of heat, triggering an NRC notifciation. On 3/15/2024 at approximately 2200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5013755 at the station location in Baton Rouge, reporting a package with a dangerous evolution of heat. The shipment consisted of 12 D cell batteries which, after further inspection, appeared to be swollen. During delivery, the driver discovered the package was warm to the touch and returned it to the station. This incident has been to be NRC under Report # 1393991 was generated by Ms. Rawls. Due to the reporting requirements to the NRC, this shipment is also being reported to the FAA and is being held for further disposition instructions.

The one (1) damaged 55-gallon metal drum of paint was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum for further transport.   • Description: On 3/14/2024 at approximately 2158, Dangerous Goods Administation received a call from Employee 240946 at a station location in Spokane, reporting an undeclared deisel spill. The shipment consists of what appears to be a diesel fuel pump containing fuel residue. The shipment was discovered leaking during sort. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, being void of the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • City: TUCKER
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On March 11, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN2054 were damaged during transit due to lack of dunnage and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2054 impacted trailer floor and neutralized the product on the pallet. FCE deconstructed the pallet and restacked the remaining intact freight for further transport. All spent absorbents and neutralized debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal open-top drum for further handling. The two (2) damaged metal pails were placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal open top drum for disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal jerrican and metal bottle in zip-tied plastic bags inside corrugated carton with styrofoam peanut filler. Defective spout weld on jerrican allowed leakage which shriveled styrofoam peanut filler, soiled jerrican, and damaged carton. Carton still bears label from previous shipping under TRK # 789447976697, returned as improper hazmat for missing hazmat documents on 23 Jan 2024. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report E-2024030307
item.description:
Report E-2024030307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: EAST PEORIA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4in-by-4in area of the trailer floor and cardboard packaging and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a weld failure on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Enviroserve personnel transferred the remaining product into two (2) 275-gallon poly tote and shipped on to the consignee. The released material was scrapped from the trailer floor and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail along with impacted cardboard from the other freight. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024030297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN3266 Flash Clene 1414 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 cups of product released to 1' x 1' area on the trailer floor and a 1' x 4' area on the trailer wall due to a cracked tote corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted areas were then neutralized and cleaned with soda ash and absorbent pads. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS SENT TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO A WET SPOT VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER X8003V, HARTFORD TECHNOLOGY - DC, 7806 BRAYGREEN RD, LAUREL MD 20707-5169.

item.title: Report E-2024030316
item.description:
Report E-2024030316

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: EAST MOLINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-5ft area of the terminal concrete floor and estimated that one-hundred and thirty (130) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote along with rinse water that was used to neutralize two (2) 85-gallon metal drums that Dayton terminal personnel used to collect the leaking product in prior to the contractors arrival. The rinse water was offloaded into one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted flooring and collected the spent absorbents and containerized it along with impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UKC experienced a UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide 45% release from (4) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to 6 x 6 area of the top of each poly drum. All four drums in shipment were found to have faulty bung caps, causing them to release. Each drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack after being wiped down. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2024030638

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD DOOR FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER BEGAN CLEANING UP THE SPILL. DURING THE RESPONSE, RESPONDER DISCOVERED A FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT TO BE CONTAMINATED BY THE LEAKING PACKAGE. UPON BRINGING THE LEAKING PACKAGE, CONTAMINATED DEBRIS, AND SOILED PACKAGES BACK TO THE DMP CAGE, THE HAZMAT'S INNER CONTAINERS HAD BEEN DISCOVERED TO BE SOILED BY THE LEAKER, AS WELL AS THE OUTER PACKAGING, AND NEEDED TO BE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024030300
item.description:
Report E-2024030300

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Dayton Freights personnel observed that an estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to a small puncture to the bottom of one (1) 50-gallon metal drum. Dayton Freights personnel deployed granular absorbents and recovered the spent material and containerized into one (1) overpack 120-gallon poly drum along with the damaged 50-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030644
item.description:
Report X-2024030644

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE CAME IN THE TRAILER TO LOAD PACKAGES AND SAW DISTRESSED HAZMAT PACKAGE ON TRAILER FLOOR IN UPRIGHT POSITION. HE LEFT NOTIFYING HIS SUPERVISOR. CAME TO RESPOND. SHE HAD HER PPE ON. SHE NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR THAT IT WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT AND VERBALLY THE AREA WAS CORDONED OFF. SHE FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET ADDING SILVERSHIELD LINERS UNDER HER NITRILE GLOVES. SHE CONTAINERIZED THE BOX IN SPILL TUB. SHE PH TESTED THE FLOOR AS THERE WERE MULTIPLE STAINS ON FLOOR. THE PH WAS 9. SHE USED WATER AND A PAPER TOWEL TO NEUTRALIZE PH TO 7. SHE WIPED AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. BECAUSE OF LENGTH OF STAINS, SHE CHECKED THE ROLLERS AND PACKAGES. ALL ROLLERS AND PACKAGES WERE CLEAN. DUE TO DAMPNESS AND TIME, SHE OBTAINED A CORRUGATED PIECE OF CARDBOARD TO COVER ENTIRE ALL STAINS ON THE FLOOR. SHE BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER AND FOLLOWED PROPER DMP PROCEDURE AND DISPOSITION OF PACKAGE.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN1760 Nalco 5177 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the tote lid due to a fault cap. The cap was replaced with a new one and the tote body was wiped down and secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbent pads and PPE were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: X-2024030136: Tank car releasing vapor from both vapor valves and liquid valve. All three valves in open position and plugs less than tool tight. Valves were closed and plugs tightened. X-2024030139: Liquid valve and A end vapor valve found with vapor release. Both valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Liquid valve plug had insufficient tape to properly secure plug. Both valves were closed. Liquid valve plug re-taped then both plugs tightened properly. X-2024030140: Liquid valve found releasing vapor past the plug. Valve in open position, plug had insufficient tape to secure and plug less than tool tight. Valve was closed, plug re-taped then plug tightened. X-2024030141: Odor of leaking car from ground. Inspection found liquid valve and A end vapor valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Both valves were closed and plugs tightened.

  • Description: Driver was at another delivery making a delivery when he noticed a shipment of pails on his truck slightly leaning. In a proactive measure, the driver decided to take the shipment off the truck at the current customer he was at to restack and stretch wrap it before something bad happened. When taking the shipment off of his trailer when he was crossing the dockplate with the shipment three pails fell off of the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was contained and confined and an outside response company was called in to help cleanup and remediate.

  • City: HAGERSTOWN

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the 150-gallon poly tote and the contractor was unable to determine the volume of material released due to a forklift puncture of one (1) 150-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that they believed that some of the released material evaporated. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining material into a new poly tote and generated one (1) 55-gallon poly drum containing the cut-up poly tote, impacted absorbents and PPE. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver 18151 was dispatched for a load going to Lake Park Mobil but was given a customer information sheet for Northlake Mobil. Driver did not catch this mistake and went to the wrong location. Once he arrived, he obtained an ATG reading that verified his load would not fit. The driver overfilled the tank and this resulted in a spill that impacted a drain. After investigating this with the APEC rep it was determined that the Reg tank was able to hold an additional 200 gallons of regular. Because the tanks are manifolded the rest of the product flowed into the premium tank. Only approximately 12 gallons of product was actually spilled. CDG managed the response and cleanup.

  • Description: RSR Crew was inspecting a set of cars in Silver Springs Siding that NS had set out. Crew noticed car #UTLX 209221 leaking diesel fuel and immediately notified RSR Trainmaster, Matthew Quattrone and Director Environmental Rita Mager. Car UTLX 209221 was set out by NS about 12 hours before RSR crew got there and were not sure how long it had been leaking. It was a slow leak - about 1 drop every 12 to 15 seconds. RSR Crew contained the spill. Rita Mager contacted SPSI who responded to site for repairs to car. Per SPSI, repairs noted as 'Tightened the packing nut of the valve stem packing to stop the leak." Report sent to car owner, who issued the OTMA.

  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. The outer box was torn/damaged. During inspection of the inner contents, it was found to contain a battery. Item#/Part# 840-111-819-001, Odyssey Extreme, ODX-AGM65 Held pending FAA investigation.

The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • City: MACEDONIA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 8 and was attempting to take the ramp onto I 271 North. For unknown reasons, the KAG Energy, LLC driver lost control of the unit and and went off the overpass. The tractor and trailer were immediately engulfed in fire. 7497 gallons of diesel fuel being hauled on the trailer was lost. A nearby creek was impacted by the spilled diesel fuel. Hepaco Environmental and Atlas Environmental were dispatched to the scene and continue to remediate the release.

item.title: Report X-2024030225
item.description:
Report X-2024030225

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was discovered in trailer during unloading. Package was actively leaking, no noted damage to outer packaging. upon inspection of package, I found one, one pint of paint related material was leaking due to cap failure, The other 11 cans were soiled and dented. There was a second package inside with the HAZMAT, a limited quantity that was undeclared, it was not damaged. Outer packaging for bother inner boxes, could have fit at least 6 of the same size inner boxes. There was a little air bags inside, but not enough to keep inner packages from moving around. The cap failure caused about 1\2 of one pint to leak out. Leaking container was removed and turned right side up to stop leaking. DescribePack: cap failed to seal properly causing contents to leak. Posible caused by insufficient inner packing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking can was removed from box and sat upright to stop leaking, all items were placed in a black plastic bin with a bag.
